options.description: use homopolymer-compressed k-mer
k-mer size (no larger than 28) [15]
minimizer window size [50]
input file containing list of high freq. k-mers []
split index for every ~NUM input bases [4G]
dump index to FILE []
filter out top FLOAT (<1) fraction of repetitive minimizers [0.0]
stop chain enlongation if there are no minimizers in INT-bp [5000]
max intron length (effective with -xsplice; changing -r) [200k]
max fragment length (effective with -xsr or in the fragment mode) [800]
bandwidth used in chaining and DP-based alignment [500]
minimal number of minimizers on a chain [3]
minimal chaining score (matching bases minus log gap penalty) [40]
skip self and dual mappings (for the all-vs-all mode)
min secondary-to-primary score ratio [0.8]
turn off SV-aware mode
matching score [2]
mismatch penalty [4]
gap open penalty [4,24]
gap extension penalty; a k-long gap costs min{O1+k*E1,O2+k*E2} [2,1]
Z-drop score and inversion Z-drop score [400,200]
minimal peak DP alignment score [80]
how to find GT-AG. f:transcript strand, b:both strands, n:don't match GT-AG [n]
output in the SAM format (PAF by default)
output alignments to FILE [stdout]
write CIGAR with >65535 ops at the CG tag
SAM read group line in a format like '@RG\tID:foo\tSM:bar' []
output CIGAR in PAF
output the cs tag; STR is 'short' (if absent) or 'long' [none]
output the MD tag
write =/X CIGAR operators
use soft clipping for supplementary alignments
manually set pthread count rather than automatically
minibatch size for mapping [1000M]
show version number

preset (always applied before other options) [] - map-ont (ont-to-ref, uses default param) - map-pb (hifi-to-ref, all defaults but does finer read fragmentation in SV-aware mapping) - map-pb-clr (clr-to-ref, sets --sv-off) - splice/splice:hq - long-read/Pacbio-CCS spliced alignment, sets --sv-off - asm5/asm10/asm20 - asm-to-ref mapping
